reviewText: I bought the entire 5 DVD series to use in my group program for families who have loved ones or acquaintances with BPD. Everyone in my groups have stated that this has been the most meaningful and helpful part of the entire program because it helps them see the perspective of both the person who has BPD and their loved ones. It is excellent, with great professional information as well as the family perspectives. in rating it, I think it is more fair to rate the caliber and quality of the DVDs as opposed to the cost. Yes, it is expensive, but it is a great series and invaluable for mental health professionals to use with clients, especially in groups.
Yep, the information found in the 5 DVD set is so valuable.  Unfortunately, you will have to cough up $500 if you really want to know.  And then, keep working those skills and boundaries.

How do you justify $100 each for a series of 5?  Do the creators of this DVD really want to help anyone?  Was it necessary to charge this price in order to recoup what it took to make it and make a reasonable profit?  Yeah, that's what I thought.  Ditto for the other 4.
